TopicTitle: The Third Great Number War: The Long Haul!

Articles.Content:
17 Wheheheheeeee!

Edited April 18, 2022 by Nazalassa
ninja'd

We have spent endless hours on the forums, trying to understand the wave of positivity. Are we going to be the victim of a positive dictatorship? The positives destroyed us. They took no prisoners. This is what we fight to stop. Because the negatives serve the good, because we fight not just to destroy the darkness in front us, but to save the light behind us

16

Edited April 18, 2022 by SSTO Crasher

1 minute ago, SSTO Crasher said:

Are we going to be the victim of a positive dictatorship?

In fact, here's how I think everything started:

Positives were good on land and not good on great waters (bigger than lakes) and Negatives were good on water but not good on great land (bigger than medium islands).

At the beginning, Pos. and Neg. lived together in a mix of roman/medieval civilization. They were two different ethnies (Positives were like humans and Negatives were twice as short as Pos. and had pointed ears, they are Gnomes for those who play D&D) and the government was two consuls: at any time there was one Positive consul and one Negative consul. They were "refreshed" evey 15 years. One day the Pos. consul wanted to destroy Negatives beause he thought of [whatever he thought]. So he kidnapped the Neg. consul one night (he knocked her off with a bowl) and wrote a letter with her writing, stating that she stole some of the most precious jewels and flew away. He then put the letter in the Negative ex-consul's wardrobe (don't ask) and imprisonned her in a remote-located fortress he secretly built for that purpose (this was just a huge prison). Then he hid the jewels somewhere and the next morning everyone was, "Oooh who stole the jewels, where is the Negative consul" and after a bit of searching a Negative citizen found the letter. The Pos. consul took it and read it before anyone could and the whole city was like, "Damn Negatives are traitors", "Damn this is a fake letter", depending of whether the person who said it was Pos. or Negative. Then the consul declared Negatives were traitors and they were all condemned to death. At this moment all the Negatives flew with the "roman" aspect of the civilization (without slavery because yes the romans of antiquit had slaves but there was not slavery in this world).

They escaped on boats that has been prepared for a quick escape in secret harbours (because of an order of the Negative consul three months ago) but a third of the Negatives were killed before they could fly and that's the beginning of the First Number War. The first third of the war was Negatives trying to get to the boats, the second third was the Negatives escaping (battles on sea) and the third third was battles to prevent the Negatives from flying too far (these completely failed). At the end of the war rthe Negatives were secretly installed on two islands in the southern cold seas.

19 minutes ago, SSTO Crasher said:

They took no prisoners.

That story explains why. Their goal is to destroy us Negatives. Our goal as Negatives is to survive and build a Sea Empire to counter the Positive Land Empire.

17

Then 2nd Number War: Positives try to stop the Negatives (and if possible destroy them). There is a war and quickly it seems that the Negatives were more prepared. At the end the Negatives have finished their Empire (the Negative Union) and the Positives too.

Peace for years.

Then general Atomikku declared war over the Negative Union in a try to destroy their Empire but it seems that it's a total failure. Right now the Negatives havs gained islands.

17     I fight for nobody (I'm chaotic) but I see myself as a Negative.

Even if in the story I decide to be a Snow Dragon (horse-sized dragon with a 15-meter-long tail).

And I decide to.

Say hello to Snow Dragon @Nazalassa!

Whatever makes anyone think that light is a positive number?

 

16

16 Oh sorry, 15!

9 minutes ago, cantab said:

Whatever makes anyone think that light is a positive number?

Maybe because people think that speed can't be Negative -- but it can! It's called, "moving backwards".

And you know speed of light.
